Text: Switch between dark and light mode (currently light mode)
The i18n system of Docusaurus is <b10>decoupled from any translation software</b10>.
You can integrate Docusaurus with the <b10>tools and SaaS of your choice</b10>, as long as you put the <b11>translation files at the correct location</b11>.
We document the usage of <b10>Crowdin</b10>, as <b11>one</b11> possible <b12>integration example</b12>.

This is <b10>not an endorsement of Crowdin</b10> as the unique choice to translate a Docusaurus site, but it is successfully used by Facebook to translate documentation projects such as <b11>Jest</b11>, <b12>Docusaurus</b12>, and <b13>ReasonML</b13>.
Refer to the <b10><b20>Crowdin documentation</b20></b10> and <b11><b20>Crowdin support</b20></b11> for help.
Use this <b10><b20>community-driven GitHub discussion</b20></b10> to discuss anything related to Docusaurus + Crowdin.
Crowdin is a translation SaaS, offering a <b10>free plan for open-source projects</b10>.
We recommend the following translation workflow:
Crowdin provides a <b10>CLI</b10> to <b11>upload sources</b11> and <b12>download translations</b12>, allowing you to automate the translation process.
The <b10><b20>crowdin.yml</b20> configuration file</b10> is convenient for Docusaurus, and permits to <b11>download the localized translation files at the expected location</b11> (in ).
Read the <b10><b20>official documentation</b20></b10> to know more about advanced features and different translation workflows.
